work.summary: Worked on a range of computational chemistry projects with Prof. Tom Kurtzman (01/2014-05/2016, at Lehman College) and with Prof. Marilyn Gunner (06/2016 to present, at City College)
highlights: Developed SSTMap, a cross-platform software tool to analyze large-scale highdimensional simulations with statistical mechanics algorithms.
Currently working on the development and application of Monte Carlo simulations methods to predict chemical states of biological molecules inside cells.

work.summary: Designed and taught computational biology courses to undergraduate and postgraduate researchers, conducted bioinformatics training workshops for molecular biology researchers and set up a small bioinformatics laboratory.
highlights: Developed predictive models of drug resistance against Hepatitis C Virus therapies in local population, by integrating high-throughput data analysis of DNA sequences with 3-D modeling of protein structures.

work.summary: Carried out testing of health informatics tools designed for acquisition, storage and retrieval of healthcare data. Interacted with users and provided feedback to developers.
Analyzed signaling networks in post-synaptic neurons. Integrated atomic-scale models into a protein interaction network.
